content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Use the following graph to answer parts (a)-(e). Prices and costs are in dollars.

The graph above shows the demand (<math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>), marginal revenue (<math alttext="M R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>), marginal cost (<math alttext="M C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>), and average total cost (<math alttext="A T C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>) curves for one of many profit-maximizing firms operating in the short run in an industry in which there are no barriers to entry. Each firm sells a similar but not identical product.

(a) Assume the firm produces <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> units. Will the firm’s economic profit be positive, negative, or zero? Explain.

(b) If the firm charges <math alttext="$12" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, should this firm increase its price, decrease its price, or keep the price at <math alttext="$12" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> in order to maximize its total revenue? Explain.

(c) If the firm decreases its price from <math alttext="$32" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="$28" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>28</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, does the deadweight loss increase, decrease, or remain unchanged? Explain.

(d) Identify the profit-maximizing quantity and price, and explain how you determined each.

(e) Calculate the total cost of producing the profit-maximizing quantity identified in part (d). Show your work.
